intro: Virecta glomerata, commonly known as the clustered vireya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Virecta glomerata prefers humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
